title: Work equals energy exchange with surroundings

content.prompt: During which process is the amount of work done on the gas equal to the amount of energy that the gas exchanges with its surroundings through heating or cooling?

choices.label: None of the processes; the amount of work done on the gas is always greater than the amount of energy that the gas exchanges with its surroundings through heating or cooling.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
